main.title: Protecting Canine Lives in Cambodia
main.desc: A research initiative raising awareness about the dog meat trade in Kampot Province and promoting canine welfare.

about.title: About Our Initiative
about.desc: A Tail of Hope is a research initiative led by IFL senior students, ocusing on the use of dogs for nourishment and trade in Kampot Province.

1.title: Our Background
1.content: Our initiative was founded out of concern for animal welfare and the growing issue of dog meat trade in Cambodia. Seeing its impact on animals and communities, we aim to inform the public, advocate for better regulations, and support humane treatment of dogs.

2.title: Research Focus
2.content: We focus on the social, cultural, and economic factors behind the dog meat trade in Kampot Province. Our research explores public perceptions, health risks, and the emotional impact on pet owners, with the goal of offering practical solutions to reduce the trade and promote responsible pet ownership.

3.title: Our Team
3.content: We are senior IFL students, united by our passion for animal welfare. Working together with local communities, animal rescue groups, and experts, we strive to ensure our research creates meaningful change.

issue.title: The Issue
issue.desc: The dog meat trade in Cambodia raises concerns related to health, emotional well-being, and the limited presence of clear regulations. This practice continues in some communities and may affect both people and animals in different ways.

1.title: Health Risks
1.content: Dog meat consumption can spread rabies and other diseases, especially when hygiene and safety standards are lacking.

2.title: Emotional Impact
2.content: Many families experience distress when their pets are taken or lost to the trade, as dogs are often seen as companions.

3.title: Lack of Regulation
3.content: The absence of clear laws and enforcement allows the trade to continue, raising concerns for both animal welfare and public health.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.desc: Through this project, we aim to promote canine welfare and raise awareness about the dangers of the dog meat trade.

1.title: Raise Awareness
1.content: We aim to educate the public about the health risks, such as rabies and other zoonotic diseases as well as the emotional and ethical consequences of dog meat consumption.

2.title: Promote Regulations
2.content: We work with local authorities and stakeholders to push for effective regulations that ban the dog meat trade and safeguard animal rights.

3.title: Support Rescue Efforts
3.content: In partnership with Dirty Paws, we help rescue dogs from the meat trade, ensure they receive proper medical care, and find them safe, loving homes.
